#summary How to add new KiCAD libraries to your projects

This example will use the Opendous KiCAD libraries available through [http://code.google.com/p/opendous/source/browse/trunk/Current_Designs/KiCAD_Libraries SVN] or in the [http://code.google.com/p/opendous/downloads/list downloads] section as _KiCAD_Libraries-?.zip_.

This quick tutorial is for an older version of `KiCad`.  The [http://www.kicad-pcb.org/display/KICAD/Installing+KiCad KiCad] website has many newer [http://www.kicad-pcb.org/display/KICAD/Tutorials tutorials].


== Adding Schematic Symbol Libraries ==

After starting or [http://code.google.com/p/opendous/wiki/KiCADTutorialOpeningProjects opening] a project, run *EEschema*.  Select _Library_ from the _Preferences_ menu:

http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Add_Symbol_Library-01.jpg

Click the _Add_ button to insert a new library:

http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Add_Symbol_Library-02.jpg

Find `opendous.lib` in `/library/` directory where you extracted [http://code.google.com/p/opendous/downloads/list KiCAD_Libraries-?.zip].

Click _Save Cfg_ to save the configuration file for the current project:

http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Add_Symbol_Library-03.jpg

The library contents will now be available to your project.  Check by opening the _Library Browser_

http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Add_Symbol_Library-04.jpg

And browse the new library contents:

http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Add_Symbol_Library-05.jpg


== Adding Layout Footprint Libraries ==

After starting or [http://code.google.com/p/opendous/wiki/KiCADTutorialOpeningProjects opening] a project, run *PCBnew*.  Select _Library_ from the _Preferences_ menu:

http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Add_Module_Library-01.jpg

Click the _Add_ button to insert a new library:

http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Add_Module_Library-02.jpg

Find `opendous.mod` in `/modules/` directory where you extracted [http://code.google.com/p/opendous/downloads/list KiCAD_Libraries-?.zip].

The library contents will now be available to your project when running _CVPCB_, the schematic symbol to module linker.  Click _Save Cfg_ to save the configuration file for the current project:

http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Add_Module_Library-03.jpg
